title: Windows 10 update on 9/15 crashes league...help
body:
So, on 9/15/2016 windows 10 ran a huge update through my computer and ever since it has messed with my league of legends. I can run the game perfectly fine up until the game actually starts, then my whole computer completely freezes and I have to do a restart. This has caused me two losses now....(two because I thought the first time was just a weird fluke, but now it's apparent that it is obviously a reoccurring issue) Another thing to add is that I closed all other applications the second time just to be sure....If anyone could help I would love to play ranked again lol... One more thing to note is that the other games I play such as Overwatch and World of Warcraft are completely fine...

These are my laptop's specs:


Operating System
	Windows 10 Home 64-bit
CPU
	Intel Core i5 5200U @ 2.20GHz	38 °C
	Broadwell-U 14nm Technology
RAM
	6.00GB Dual-Channel DDR3 @ 798MHz (11-11-11-28)
Motherboard
	LENOVO Lenovo Edge 15 (U3E1)
Graphics
	Generic PnP Monitor (1920x1080@60Hz)
	Intel HD Graphics 5500 (Lenovo)
Storage
	931GB Western Digital WDC WD10SPCX-24HWST1 (SATA)	34 °C
Optical Drives
	No optical disk drives detected
Audio
	Realtek High Definition Audio

replies.body: A recent windows 10 update has caused issues with the [Xbox Game Bar ](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) and how it interacts with League.  Disabling that should the problem resolved!

Just leaving a comment to thank you.
I don't really play LoL but I had the same problem with World of Warcraft with the same Windows update.

Disabling the Xbox Game Bar solved it! (I don't even use that game bar, Microsoft simply forced it on me)
Should any other WoW player have the same problem, try this fix.

Thanks a lot and have a good game.
